snippet: The attitude of political racism has died hard. It is not, in fact, dead.
abstract: Op-Ed article by history Prof Steven Hahn examines how political racism that harks back 150 years, to time of Reconstruction, still lies close to surface in America today, despite claims that re-election of Pres Obama marks reaffirmation of post-racial America; calls on Obama to articulate vision of multicultural, multiracial and more equitable America, which would strike blow against political racism that still haunts country.
lead_paragraph: The attitude of political racism has died hard. It is not, in fact, dead.
